alert.note: Alert for Eastern Sierra Slopes of Inyo County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Avalanche Watch issued February 23 at 7:45AM PST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: The Eastern Sierra Avalanche Center in Mammoth Lakes has issued a Backcountry Avalanche Watch for the following areas: the Eastern Sierra in Mono County and the Eastern Sierra in Inyo County * WHAT...The avalanche danger is expected to rise to HIGH at all elevations by 7 am PST Friday, February 24th. * WHERE...The eastern slopes of the Sierra Nevada mountain range between Virgina Lakes on the north to Bishop Creek on the south. * WHEN...In effect until 7 am PST Friday. * IMPACTS...2 feet or more of new snow and strong winds will stress a weak upper snowpack. Travel will be difficult. Expect widespread areas of unstable snow. * PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...Very dangerous avalanche conditions are expected to develop overnight. Travel in avalanche terrain is not recommended. Avalanches may break widely and run long distances into mature forests, valley floors, or flat terrain. Consult http://www.esavalanche.org or www.avalanche.org for more detailed information Similar avalanche danger may exist at locations outside the coverage area of this or any avalanche center.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Sierra Slopes of Inyo County
